label: 勧進能
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: Originally, nō plays staged on temple or shrine grounds in order to collect funds for religious purposes. Later this function was merely a pretense, as funds went to the theater operator. Staging such a performance usually required permission from government authorities.
